ca.ualberta.cmput301f13t13.storyhoard.dataClasses

Class Choice

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.ualberta.cmput301f13t13.storyhoard.dataClasses.Choice

  • public class Choice
extends java.lang.Object
    Role: A container to hold choice information. This includes id, chapteridto, chapteridfrom, and text.
    Author:
    Ashley Brown

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Choice(java.util.UUID id, java.util.UUID chapterIdFrom)
      Initializes a new choice object that will hold search criteria.
      Choice(java.util.UUID chapterIdFrom, java.util.UUID chapterIdTo, java.lang.String text)
      Initializes a new choice object with no id.
      Choice(java.util.UUID id, java.util.UUID chapterIdFrom, java.util.UUID chapterIdTo, java.lang.String text)
      Initializes a new choice object with a UUID id (needed for making a new choice after retrieving data from the database).

    • Constructor Detail

      • Choice

        public Choice(java.util.UUID chapterIdFrom,
      java.util.UUID chapterIdTo,
      java.lang.String text)
        Initializes a new choice object with no id. Example:
        To search for a choice whose text is "turn left" and has the chapters "5231b533-ba17-4787-98a3-f2df37de2aD7" and "5231b533-ba17-4787-98a3-f2df37de2aD8", construct the Choice criteria holder like this:
        Choice criteria = new Choice( "the boss", "5231b533-ba17-4787-98a3-f2df37de2aD7", "5231b533-ba17-4787-98a3-f2df37de2aD8");

        To search for a choice whose id is "5231b533-ba17-4787-98a3-f2df37de2aA7",nd has the chapters "5231b533-ba17-4787-98a3-f2df37de2aD7" and "5231b533-ba17-4787-98a3-f2df37de2aD8" build the choice criteria holder like this:
        UUID id = UUID.fromString("5231b533-ba17-4787-98a3-f2df37de2aA7");
        Choice criteria = new Choice(id, "5231b533-ba17-4787-98a3-f2df37de2aA7", "5231b533-ba17-4787-98a3-f2df37de2aA8");
        Parameters:
        chapterIdFrom - The id of the current chapter being read
        chapterIdTo - The id of the chapter the choice links to
        text - The text of the choice

      • Choice

        public Choice(java.util.UUID id,
      java.util.UUID chapterIdFrom,
      java.util.UUID chapterIdTo,
      java.lang.String text)
        Initializes a new choice object with a UUID id (needed for making a new choice after retrieving data from the database).
        Parameters:
        id - The Id of the choice
        chapterIdFrom - The id of the current chapter being read
        chapterIdTo - The id of the chapter the choice links to
        text - The text of the choice

      • Choice

        public Choice(java.util.UUID id,
      java.util.UUID chapterIdFrom)
        Initializes a new choice object that will hold search criteria. For this reason, only the id, story id, and the id of the chapter the choice belongs to are needed.
        Parameters:
        id - The Id of the choice
        chapterIdFrom - The id of the current chapter being read

    • Method Detail

      • setId

        public void setId(java.util.UUID id)
        Set the Id of the choice. The new Id provided must be a UUID.

        Example call:
        Choice mockChoice= (chapter1.getId(), chapter2.getId(), "turn around");
        UUID id = UUID.randomUUID();
        mockChoice.setId(id);
        Parameters:
        id - New choice id. Must be a UUID or null.

      • setCurrentChapter

        public void setCurrentChapter(java.util.UUID chapterIdFrom)
        Set the Id of the chapter the choice is in. The new Id provided must be a UUID.

        Example call:
        Choice mockChoice= (chapter1.getId(), chapter2.getId(), "turn around");
        UUID id = UUID.randomUUID();
        mockChoice.setCurrentChapter(id);
        Parameters:
        chapterIdFrom -

      • setNextChapter

        public void setNextChapter(java.util.UUID uuid)
        Set the Id of the chapter the choice is going to. The new Id provided must be a UUID.

        Example call:
        Choice mockChoice= (chapter1.getId(), chapter2.getId(), "turn around");
        UUID id = UUID.randomUUID();
        mockChoice.setNextChapter(id);
        Parameters:
        chapterIdTo -

      • setText

        public void setText(java.lang.String text)
        Set the text of the choice.

        Example call:
        Choice mockChoice= (chapter1.getId(), chapter2.getId(), "turn around");
        String text = "working";
        mockChoice.setText(text);
        Parameters:
        text - The text you want the choice to display. Must be a string.

      • getId

        public java.util.UUID getId()
        Returns the Id of the choice as a UUID.

        Example:
        Choice mockChoice= (chapter1.getId(), chapter2.getId(), "turn around");
        UUID id = mockChoice.getId();
        System.out.println(id);

        Output would be something like: "5231b533-ba17-4787-98a3-f2df37de2aD7"
        Returns:
        Id

      • getCurrentChapter

        public java.util.UUID getCurrentChapter()
        Returns the Id of the chapter the choice is in as a UUID.

        Example:
        Choice mockChoice= (chapter1.getId(), chapter2.getId(), "turn around");
        UUID id = mockChoice.CurrentChapter();
        System.out.println(id);

        Output would be something like: "5231b533-ba17-4787-98a3-f2df37de2aD7"
        Returns:
        currentChapterId

      • getNextChapter

        public java.util.UUID getNextChapter()
        Returns the Id of the chapter the choice is going to as a UUID.

        Example:
        Choice mockChoice= (chapter1.getId(), chapter2.getId(), "turn around");
        UUID id = mockChoice.getNextChapter();
        System.out.println(id);

        Output would be something like: "5231b533-ba17-4787-98a3-f2df37de2aD7"
        Returns:
        nextChapterId

      • getText

        public java.lang.String getText()
        Returns the text of the choice.

        Example:
        Choice mockChoice= (chapter1.getId(), chapter2.getId(), "turn around");
        String text = mockChoice.getText();
        System.out.println(text);

        Output would be: "turn around"
        Returns:
        text
